title: Re: Merry Christmas!
content:
Aww, I had a cup of coffee this morning! So many days without coffee, and finally... a cup of coffee without sugar!! Delicious.

Um, what was this all about? Ah, yes. *shakes head*

Merry Christmas/Whatever and happy new year for everyone! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-christmas.gif[/img]

[quote]Quote:[hr]Genius314: You're two days early!!![hr][/quote]

Well, that's probably because some of us may be unavaiable for Christmas day. I think that's the idea when posting two days before xmas. (I know a lot of people who travel somewhere for Christmas... I stay at home, anyway.)[hr][img]http://img136.imageshack.us/img136/983/vegetableswk2.gif[/img]

title: Re: Merry Christmas!
content:
Merry 14th year since TUIT wasn't released. Enjoy this Romanised solstice celbration, and I hope it contains some meaning for you all.

Hopefully it does for me as well, since I've long found it difficult to enjoy the day as much as I used to.[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-spotkeen.gif[/img]

title: Re: Merry Christmas!
content:
Well, I'll be home but I still wanted to post it a bit advance, so people have time to post their greetings. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img]

Spleen, it's 15th already.. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-sad.gif[/img] 3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: Merry Christmas!
content:
Actually TUIT wasn't released in 314 BC either to name a "random" example, so the number can be anything you want really.
Unless you're talking about "the year it should've been released, but wasn't".Retodon8

title: Re: Merry Christmas!
content:
We're talking about Christmas 1992, when Keen was supposed to return with TUIT!

1992 - 1st year without TUIT, as it was promised that year and didn't appear!
1993 - 2nd..
1994 - 3rd..
1995 - 4, 1996 - 5, 1997 - 6, 1998 - 7, 1999 - 8, 2000 - 9, 2001 - 10, 2002 - 11, 2003 - 12, 2004 - 13, 2005 - 14
2006 - 15th year without it! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-garg.gif[/img]
I thought it this way.. But I guess you're counting 1993 as the first year. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] 3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: Merry Christmas!
content:
Well, one DAY without TUIT is too much... We want Keen 7!!-Genius314

title: Re: Merry Christmas!
content:
[hrKeenRush But I guess you're counting 1993 as the first year. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]
[hr]Ah yes, there's the confusion; "years since" as opposed to "years without". I had a hell of a time working my head around the logic. At first it was '12' for some reason.

It's Christmas here. Should be a good day. Having a large extended family makes for very interesting Christmas gatherings.

title: Re: Merry Christmas!
content:

Hmm...I can only think of ROTT - surely there must be other games with Christmas easter eggs in them...
